reviews.review:
Wait till the devs get half a brain. They always have something they screwed up going on. And this game like no other lets toxic players be extremely toxic with little to no downside for them.

In depth: 

Also the devs dont understand how to balance at all, its not unplayable but its noticeably bad at times. They buff some off the most used perks in the game, and seemingly nerf bad perks. As well as adding perks that would be great for new players but they are behind a paywall. But it should be a very big red flag that at high ranks you can guess most, if not all, of the builds of each survivor before the match starts. (there are 95 perks) They could easily look at some of the very well made metas of other games, like hearthstone, but they don't. Killer is not as bad but there are some killer perks that really just outshine all the other perks. If they did some basic basic research into how other game balance they know that have a very small set of perks, maybe like 8 of them, being picked vastly more than any others is a sign of a bad meta. 

A example of the toxic players is like how a killer can down the first player and face camp them for the whole match. The hooked player gets no points and cant do anything about it. If the dc they lose the little points they got and cant play for a while for the DC. The other players do the gens fast (which are needed to win) and get out but they win so fast they also get little points. If you care about ranking, everyone deranks as well. On the flip side survivors can make the game last as long as they wish if they are winning. The killer has the exact same dc problems. There is no way to surrender or move on to the next game quickly. Simply if players want to be toxic they can ruin the match for everyone no matter the role. If you play for points, rank, fun, or even just achievements, players on both side have the power to ruin any and all of those things with no punishment. This is the number 1 reason this game isnt as popular and loved like fallout or skyrim or COD or minecraft. It'll only take one other company to make a clone of this game and do a better job at it to bring this game down. Which at this stage is far to easy. 

Sorry for any grammar errors or spelling mistakes
I really enjoy it more than i tought i would, but i think its sad you cant communicate with the palyers while you are on a match.

The core gameplay is fun, but public matchmaking is abysmal, the dev studio could not care less about balance, the ingame currency economy is predatory, the community is unbelievably toxic, 90% of the content has to be bought with real money and the game itself is still unacceptably buggy. 

Good with friends, miserable solo.

I would not recommend this game until they set the game on a more even footing between killers and survivors. The game caters and promotes killers to be toxic. Allowing and condoning face camping and tunneling and wonder why people disconnect frequently.

Jogo divertido, porém segue algumas dicas antes de comprar:

1° - Não jogue como sobrevivente achando que vai ganhar, o monstro é muito roubado e provavelmente você irá ganhar 1 em cada 10 partidas.
2° - Os servidores são horríveis e em alguns horários específicos você não encontra partida de jeito nenhum.
3° - Não pague mais de R$10,00 nisso.
4° - Extremamente repetitivo, enjoa com poucas horas de jogo.
5° - Não possui sistema de bate-papo de voz, vai precisar do discord.
6° - Se não tiver amigos que tenham o jogo recomendo não comprar, fica sem graça.

I have 704 hours on this game. It used to be good. There were less toxic people and the game was balanced. Now it heavily favors the killers. They only care about reports if it involves cheating or death threats. Camping and tunneling is called a valid tactic. Which means with ALL killers being toxic that they WILL prevent you from getting any points or having fun. It's not fun, it makes me mad and upset. I've put a good amount of money in it. I regret ever even hearing about this game and i'm done with it.

If I could give this game a rating of middle of the road I really would. This game is what I like to call a bipolar game. You are either having the time of your life or you are having the exact opposite of fun, there really ain't much of a middle road. You will get upset, but you will also have a lot of fun with it, Just remember to take breaks or you might not like it for too long.

One of the best games to kill your friends with or survive with them against many different killers all with unique ability's to help them hunt down and devour their prey! I've gotten this game on both Xboxone and PC many years before cross platform was even in the talks. I love this game whole heartedly and hope it never dies! LONG LIVE DEAD BY DAYLIGHT! also "I think we've done a pretty good job so far." ;P
